inputs.name: ScheduledTaskDefinitionSource
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Definition Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory that the application or script should be ran from.

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskXmlFileToImportFrom
inputs.label: Scheduled Task XML file to import from
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The XML file defining the properties to use for this Scheduled Task.
This file can be obtained by creating a Scheduled Task in the Windows Task Scheduler and then exporting it. See [the help documentation](https://github.com/deadlydog/AzureDevOps.WindowsScheduledTasks) for more info.

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskFullName
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The full path of the Scheduled Task to install on the server(s).
If the Scheduled Task is to be installed in a directory, the directory (or directories) must also be included in the path.

Examples:
`TaskToInstall`
`MyTasks\TaskToInstall`
`MyTasks\AnotherDirectory\TaskToInstall`

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskDescription
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: A description of what the Scheduled Task does.

inputs.name: ApplicationPathToRun
inputs.label: Application Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full path of the application or script that the Scheduled Task should run on the server.

inputs.name: ApplicationArguments
inputs.label: Application Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments to pass to the appliation or script.

inputs.name: WorkingDirectoryOptions
inputs.label: Working Directory To Use
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory that the application or script should be ran from.

inputs.name: CustomWorkingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full working directory path that the application or script should be ran from.

inputs.name: ScheduleTriggerType
inputs.label: Schedule Trigger
inputs.helpMarkDown: What event should trigger the Scheduled Task to run.

options.AtLogOn: When a user logs on (At Log On)
options.AtStartup: When the system is started (At Startup)

inputs.name: AtLogOnTriggerUsername
inputs.label: Trigger Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The user that must log on to the computer in order for the Scheduled Task to be triggered to run.

inputs.name: DateTimeScheduleStartTime
inputs.label: Start Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: The time that the Scheduled Task should start at. e.g. '2019/01/21 3am', '6pm', '12pm' (noon), '12am' (midnight).

inputs.name: DateTimeScheduleFrequencyOptions
inputs.label: Schedule Frequency
inputs.helpMarkDown: How often the Scheduled Task should be ran.

inputs.name: DateTimeScheduleFrequencyDailyInterval
inputs.label: Daily Interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: How many days between running the Scheduled Task. e.g. 1 = run every day, 2 = run every other day, 3 = run every third day, etc.

inputs.name: DateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyInterval
inputs.label: Weekly Interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: How many weeks between running the Scheduled Task. e.g. 1 = run every week, 2 = run every other week, 3 = run every third week, etc.

inputs.name: ShouldDateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnMondaysString
inputs.label: Monday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run on Mondays.

inputs.name: ShouldDateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnTuesdaysString
inputs.label: Tuesday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run on Tuesdays.

inputs.name: ShouldDateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnWednesdaysString
inputs.label: Wednesday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run on Wednesdays.

inputs.name: ShouldDateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnThursdaysString
inputs.label: Thursday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run on Thursdays.

inputs.name: ShouldDateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnFridaysString
inputs.label: Friday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run on Fridays.

inputs.name: ShouldDateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnSaturdaysString
inputs.label: Saturday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run on Saturdays.

inputs.name: ShouldDateTimeScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnSundaysString
inputs.label: Sunday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run on Sundays.

inputs.name: ShouldScheduledTaskRunRepeatedlyString
inputs.label: Repeat the Scheduled Task
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run repeatedly again after being triggered.

inputs.name: ScheduleRepetitionIntervalInMinutes
inputs.label: Repetition Interval (in Minutes)
inputs.helpMarkDown: How long to wait after the Scheduled Task is triggered before triggering it again. e.g. A value of 60 will trigger the Scheduled Task every hour.

inputs.name: ScheduleRepetitionDurationInMinutes
inputs.label: Repetition Duration (in Minutes)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum number of minutes to continue triggering the Scheduled Task for after it was initially triggered. e.g. A value of 1440 would allow the Repetition Interval to retrigger the task for 24 hours.

inputs.name: ScheduleStartTimeRandomDelayInMinutes
inputs.label: Start Time Random Delay (in Minutes)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The maximum amount of minutes to delay the start time of the trigger. The delay will be a random value between zero and the number of minutes specified here.

You may want to use this to stagger when the job starts if you have many jobs set to start at the same time.

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskAccountToRunAsOptions
inputs.label: User To Run As
inputs.helpMarkDown: The user that the Scheduled Task should run as.

inputs.name: CustomAccountToRunScheduledTaskAsUsername
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the user or system account that the Scheduled Task should run as.

inputs.name: CustomAccountToRunScheduledTaskAsPassword
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The password of the user or system account that the Scheduled Task should run as.

As a best practice, a secret variable should be passed in here so that other users cannot see the password in plain text.

inputs.name: ShouldScheduledTaskBeEnabledString
inputs.label: Enabled
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task be enabled after it is installed; Unselect this to have it be installed as disabled.

inputs.name: ShouldScheduledTaskRunWithHighestPrivilegesString
inputs.label: Run With Highest Privileges
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run using the highest privileges.

inputs.name: ShouldScheduledTaskRunAfterInstallString
inputs.label: Run after installed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to have the Scheduled Task run immediately after it is installed.

inputs.name: ComputerNames
inputs.label: Computer Names
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A comma-separated list of computers to connect to and install the Scheduled Task on.

Leave blank to have it run on the agent's local computer.

inputs.name: Username
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The username to use when connecting to the computers and installing the Scheduled Task.

Leave blank to use the identity that the agent is running as.

inputs.name: Password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The password to use when connecting to the computers and installing the Scheduled Task.

As a best practice, a secret variable should be passed in here so that other users cannot see the password in plain text.

Leave blank to use the identity that the agent is running as.

inputs.name: UseCredSspString
inputs.label: Use CredSSP
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select this to use CredSSP when connecting to remote servers.

CredSSP lets an application delegate the credentials from the client to the target server for remote authentication.

In order to use this setting, you may need to first run the PowerShell command 'Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role Server -Force' on the remote servers to enable them to accept requests that use CredSSP. If this is not enabled on the remote server the task may get 'Access is denied' or 'Authentication mechanism' errors when connecting to the remote server.
